name: InterContinental Prague

reviews.title: Understated elegance in my favorite city.
reviews.text: The last time I was in Prague, I was with a friend and we were "roughing it" about four years back. We stayed in a small, locally owned "tourist class" hotel on the outskirts of the city. Needless to say, when I made my second trip back, it was for a business trip and I had the change to stay here at "The Interconti" and it was quite the step up from the first time around.

reviews.title: Opt For Another Hotel
reviews.text: As I walked into the hotel, I got the distinct feeling that when Prague was behind the Iron Curtain, this was the hotel that all the communist big-wigs stayed at. The room I stayed in was HUGE. The bathroom was marble, head to toe (except the tub and toilet). The closet was also quite generous and had plenty of hangers to put all of my clothes. The room also had a desk which was helpful, seeing as I was working EU and US hours while there.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: The staff was lovely and very helpful. They were more than proficient in English and even tolerated my half-hearted attempts at speaking Czech.

reviews.title: Good location, but a bit noisy
reviews.text: The hotel is also well situated and an easy walk to the Square and with a beautiful view of the Castle.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is a bit pricey for me (read the top of the review :-), but if I had the disposable income, it would be nice to treat myself to something this lovely again.
I had an extended stay here for business and had an opportunity to reside in the hotel proper, as well as their hotel-run apartments (a separate building 10 meters from the hotel's front entrance).
reviews.title: Good but without atmosphere
Lovely Hotel!, Great Location, very nice staff
reviews.text: The hotel itself is rather unattractive from the outside - very Communist-block era in design. Fairly recent renovations (post flood) inside keep the interior areas fresh and clean, albeit rather generic in style.

reviews.title: This is a first class operation
reviews.text: The good things: Location is phenomenal - you are at the foot of Paritska (sp?), which is essentially the Rodeo Drive of Prague and within very short walking distance from Old Town Square, and many great hidden gem restaurants. Also, the rooms are quiet - I know other people in other hotels who had tremendous problems with noisy crowds leaving bars at night, but this hotel is far enough removed from bars to be quiet. Staff is helpful and fairly efficient (especially since we only communicated in English.; Room Service and food was very nicely done; Breakfast spread is varied and very good. It's also worth noting that the comforters for the beds are wonderful (I considering buying one to take home!). The gym is rather limited but perfectly fine, as is the indoor pool and other facilities.

The bad things: during my stay, there were some incidences of cash being stolen from in-room safes. I recommend keeping valuables at the front desk vault - very easy access and more secure. This is a very corporate building with a very corporate feel - if you're looking for some Bohemian character, this is not the place for you. The rooms were a bit cramped, but the bathrooms were large and first rate.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: If you like a bit more space and prefer a little less of a hotel feel, the apartments are perfect. The furnishings are spare (in an IKEA kind of way, but better), but the layout gives you a separate bedroom and a little kitchenette. It's a discreet entrance and makes you feel as if you're living in Prague, not just visiting. The best part is that you also get hotel service - room service, maids, access to the main hotel for the gym, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for a business trip in March 2006. The hotel has a great location - along the river. It's location is an extended walking distance from the Charles Bridge. Staff is competent, but service is nothing great.
reviews.title: Functional business hotel
Location Location
reviews.text: This was our 2nd time at this hotel and we were again pleased with the room, food, and service. This hotel is perfect for sight seeing, as it is close to everything. We walked everywhere in Prague. Room was big and comfortable, it was extremely hot this trip, and we thought the air conditioning could have been better. Buffet breakfast had everything and kept us ffull uuntil the night. If you are going to Prague, sty in this hotel.

reviews.title: No 5-star treatment
reviews.text: Location of the alleged 5-star Intercontinental in Prague is sublime: overlooking the Moldau-river and at the beginning of the Paris Avenue, a delightful shopping-street, leading straight to the inner city. Check-in went ok although no warm welcome was extended. We had booked a deluxe river-side room which was OK but barely: the roomsurface was abt. 25 m² plus a 2 m long narrow corridor with cupboards, a minibar and safe. The bathroom was minimal (abt. 4m²) with only 1 wash-basin and a bath cum shower. There was no glass partition but a shower-curtain which is less hygienic. The joints between the bathroom tiles were showing black spots. Though the room is airconditioned which worked well, there is no airco in the bathroom resulting in a steamed up mirror after showering. The 2 beds were separated by 1 bedside table, the TV was of the old-fashioned type (no flatscreen) and a fresh remote-control had to be brought to our room to get the TV working. The beds are acceptable although far from Westin or Sofitel-comfort. According to a sign in the room one could ask housekeeping for a faxmachine and trouserpress, but the latter was never delivered despite our 2 calls. One day no bathroom amenities were delivered until after our phone-call. The Priority-membership entitles to a weekday newspaper, but this service started only after 2 phone-calls to the concierge. A (2 hours) later check-out (also one of the Prioriry-membership advantages) was refused at check-in, but granted at our actual day of departure. The general decor of the hotel and the rooms is dated. The Intercontinental Prague was built in the seventies for another owner and that fact is reflected in the smallness of the rooms. Apart from Four Seasons there is no real top-end competition from other leading hospitality groups which probably explains the relatively high prices and mediocre service performance.
This hotel has a reasonable location but not the best in Prague.
reviews.title: Bring a water bucket for the smoke!
nice hotel
reviews.text: I am a Platinum Ambassador Priority Club Member and was upgraded to a suite. The space was O.K. but there was no River view as guaranteed and it was a Smoking Room when I specifically require Non Smoking. I was told that there were no Non smoking Rooms available and the view of the Old Town was better than the River view so be happy!!!

I stopped here with a goup of people for a friends birthday and I must say it was one of best hotels I have stopped in. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and any requests we made were tended to straight away.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!
Please remodel me and teach me manners!
reviews.text: Food in the hotel was excellent, and even at short notice a birthday cake was produced and presented to us by the chef for my friends birthday.
I would well recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of stopping in Prague, and I myself have already booked it again for a return trip in Jan 2007.

reviews.text: Snooty staff for a shabby hotel. Not one person will say hello to you when you arrive any time of day or night. Room service was good, Location was good. Bed was so uncomfortable - it was like a college dorm. I told the Front desk - I might as well said someone jumped out of my room - I might have got the same non-reaction.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the heart of old town, the intercon is tops in terms of location. It lies along one of the poshest streets in old town Prague (Parizska st.). Lots of good restaurants in the surrounding area. The hotel itself is getting a little dated (especially after you see the new Mandarin Hotel in the Castle Quarter). But the rooms are big and clean. The staff however, especially one in the front desk, was very rude, not what you expect for the price you pay for a room in their hotel. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a good variety of dishes. There is something to be said about security though. Guidebooks always warn that Prague is a dangerous place for tourists so we thought that staying in a 5-star hotel in a nice part of town can make us more secure. Yet one evening, around 7:30pm, some friends of ours were mugged right on the side of the hotel, within hotel premises, as they were returning from a concert. Despite the ruckus, with one of our friends rolling and struggling on the ground with the assailant, none of the hotel security noticed or aided them. Something must be done about their security most definitely.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I started my trip to Europe this year in Prague, I had requested (through the hotel)that a driver pick us up at the airport upon arrival, he had me fill out a short form and on arrival at the hotel we were already checked in. This I thought was great. The hotel itself was nice but very ordinary, the room was clean and not a bad size by European standards. We were upgraded to a River view, again nice but not that big of a deal. The breakfast was quite nice, the staff always helpful. All in all a good visit but the next time I would stay at a hotel that was a little more interesting.
reviews.title: Nice but not 5-star

reviews.text: A very nice hotel and good service. I do appreciate a formal approach of czech personelle as opposed to friendly/intrusive attitude in the US. The decor is very cosmopolithan, no local flavor whatsoever, but of a very high quality. The breakfast buffet was nice, but overpriced. You will get a much better value if you cross the plaza in the back and go to a little coffee shop. Good location. Great health club, i especially enjoyed the sauna. swedish massage was also good. all in all i do not mind staying at this hotel, but for my next trip to prague i reserved a more atmospheric hotel. will let you knwo how it turn out.
reviews.title: Nice, but too cosmopolithan

reviews.text: The hotel is a refurbished and upgraded Intourist from the Communist era, hence the horrible monsteresque building. Those who care about style and design would stay clear of thise hotel - it's a fairly standard 4-star (pretending to be 5-) "chain" hotel - bland but comfortable enough.
reviews.title: Poor attitude from the staff

reviews.text: As I travelled to Prague on business, and my business partner booked the hotel, it delivered what is promised - nothing more and nothing less.
reviews.title: Great location and fine hotel

reviews.text: The only issue I have with the hotel is the attitude of certain members of staff. Upon checking out (7.30 am) I was literally "attacked" by the bell boy wanting to help me with the luggage (i.e. collect his 5 euros). Fair enough, I'm not tight, but as I only had a small case I felt perfectly able to wheel it the 10 meters from the check-in (-out) desk to the cab waiting outside, so I politely declided the bell boy's offer. To my great astonishment he then went on to INSIST on giving me a hand with the luggage and I as I was in no mood for this sort of behaviour - especially not at that hour - I had to raise my voice and tell the guy that I needed no help "thank you very much!". The bell boy, point taken, cleared off - but the receptionist - having observed the short ordeal from a short distance - in what can only be seen as a move of solidarity with her colleague, she decided to just leave, having checked me out, without even saying goodbye. Extremely unprofessional and unecessary to say the least. After all it was the Bell boy who'd put me in the awkward situation in the first place. Next time I'll stay at the Radisson.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel/location

reviews.text: the view as you pull up to the hotel is somewhat depressing. the rooms inside are better than the facade. they are large and well planned. the location is fabulous, close to so many important sights. breakfast was wonderful, with something on the buffet for everyone- healthy choices and depraved goodies.
reviews.title: commercial success
simply the best
reviews.text: very commercial, with many tour groups - says something about the value here. i'd look for something with more charm, though this was fine for a first visit to prague.
My wife and I turned up at the airport without a place to stay.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
loved the hotel.......
reviews.text: booked online, great room rate. Hotel was fabulous, worth every penny. Prague disappointing, beggars sitting for hours in the freezing cold,it appeared to be a very harsh country. Did have stunning churches and buildings, people work very long hours and are friendly. Boat trip excellent and imformative,a must do if you are thinking of going.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend during the christmas markets & it has to be one of the nicest hotels i've stayed in. We were 2 young couples, given rooms next door to each other, over looking the river. The room had everything you would need, bathrobes, elemis products, tv with plenty of english channels,fully stocked mini bar ect. Theres also a private lift to the leisure facilities and all staff in all departments were friendly and helpful.

Concierge were brilliant in dealing with all our queries including getting us one of the best tables at Cowboys (great restaurant with delicious food). The leisure facilities were excellent and everywhere was clean.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: There was plenty of choice at breakfast and it was well presented (some hot buffets can be a little off putting) and there wee also chefs on hand to make fresh omlettes.

reviews.text: The hotels at the top of a main street leading to the old town square and we couldnt have been more ideally placed, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting prague, its well worth the money.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel in a jewel of a city

reviews.text: No complaints...

reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel also has a very nice pool area, open until 10pm. (From my floor we had to take a separate elevator down to it.) It is in a big atrium and has its own drink/snack bar. I did not use the fitness equipment but the area seemed to be well equipped, and was very clean.
The breakfast buffet was very good, great selection (including international foods such as Asian selections) and wonderful jams/preserves and honey.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel.

description: Presiding regally above the hilly banks of the Vltava River, the InterContinental Prague is the landmark choice of Prague hotels, providing a sophisticated setting for all types of travel. Experience the City from its premier location - in the heart of the Prague’s historic Old Town. Magnificent accommodations provide the perfect base from which to explore the shops, restaurants, and architectural treasures that give the region its distinctive character.
